info.title: Peel Tune-in API
info.description: The machine learning service APIs utilize hashtags from Twitter to find related, trending shows, related Twitter hashtags in real time and to generate direct tune-in URLs.

tags.name: health
tags.description: Operations about health of Tune-in service

get.summary: Gets related hashtags for a show.
get.description: Returns any official hashtag and any hashtags which were learned within the most recent time window for the show.

parameters.name: timeWindow
parameters.description: Time window in seconds (default is 2 hours)

parameters.name: timeWindow
parameters.description: Time window in seconds (default is 2 hours)

get.summary: Gets tunein URLs (links) from either a tweet, hashtags, @mentions, or show ID.
get.description:
Either use tweet, hashtags, or showID as the parameter. The tunein URLs that match best are returned in order of best match.

A tweet in this context is shorthand for text from a social networking conversation, e.g., it could be from Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc., and be greater than 140 characters.

parameters.name: tweet
parameters.description: Text from a social networking conversation

parameters.name: hashtags
parameters.description: Comma separated list of hashtags and @mentions

get.summary: Get health of Tune-in service (which includes its uptime).
Gets the last 100 statuses for this show.
get.description: For Twitter, statuses are synonymous with tweets.
